lenders.name: Lift Above
lenders.loan_because: LAPO's vision is to "achieve the goal of economic empowerment of her target group through access to affordable financial services delivered in a cost-effective and innovative manner"
lenders.occupational_info:
LAPO's poverty alleviation activities are directed by the following assumptions:




The poor are too disadvantaged to benefit from existing credit schemes operated by government and formal financial institutions

The poor are not necessarily lazy

An improvement in the socio-economic situation of the poor would take place if credit. (from a common pool) is added to support their physical labour and skills.

Small groups have tremendous influence on cooperating individuals.

Poverty is reinforced by problems such as too large family size, malnutrition, ignorance and disease

Poor women and children are relatively more neglected.

lenders.name: Jonathan
lenders.loan_because:
It doesn't take a Harvard economist to see that big business can often have a catastrophic impact on the developing world.  Often foreign aid from organizations like the World Bank and WTO can do more harm than good because of the massive scope of the loans and the sometimes unfair terms and conditions under which they are granted.  Microfinance is a simple, effective method of connecting directly with individuals and small cooperatives and its rate of return is unprecedented.

It sure beats giving your charitable donation money to that creepy bearded guy on those "Save the Children Fund" commercials.
lenders.occupational_info: My work involves leveraging various technologies to deliver information over the internet.

lenders.name: www.tour.tk
lenders.loan_because: During the preparations of our world trip, we decided we would sell some of our belongings and donate the money to a good cause somewhere in the world (yet to be decided). So in the meantime, while we try to find a suitable cause, we lend it via kiva.
lenders.occupational_info:
Having sold all our belongings; paid all our debts; having said goodbye to all our friends, we will be looking forward to a five year bicycle adventure. Plenty of time to have a good look around on what we have christened our 'What a Wonderful World Tour'.

Starting off in The Netherlands on July 31, 2006 we think we can stay on the road for about five years. We wouldn't even mind if it's a bit longer... It should give us enough time to stay longer in some places, while avoiding bad weather in others.

We are building web sites and write articles while on the road.

lenders.name: Steve K.
lenders.loan_because: Having run a business for over 14 years, I have come to understand the power of cash flow.  It takes money to make money, and sometimes a small loan is enough to cause the breakthrough needed to reach success.  I can remember a day with my business when I had $6,000 in confirmed orders, but needed $2,000 in cash to release production.  A generous person listened to my need, lent me the money and two weeks later I was able to repay and use the $4,000 profit to rebuild my cash flow.  It made all the difference in the world!

"..you basically have two choices. On choice is to assume the worst, and then you can be guaranteed that it'll happen. The other is to assume that theres some hope for change, in which case its possible that you can help to effect change. So you've got two choices, one guarantees the worst will happen, the other leaves open the possibility that things might get better. Given those choices, a decent person doesn't hesitate." - N.Chomsky,

My family was poor when I was a child, and through hard work, education and dedication I am now well off. I can attest that education is the answer to poverty. This is one of the greatest ideas that I have ever seen. By funding these people, they may in turn do well for themselves and be able to afford to give their children an education, thereby breaking the cycle of poverty.

Imagine if everyone who could in the world, gave just a small fraction of their income, or a few hours of their time to help others. Imagine what the world could be.

lenders.name: Zorre
lenders.loan_because: IIn 2004 zijn we gestart met restaurant Tacos, gefinancierd met een banklening. In arme landen is het vaak moeilijk of onmogelijk om een lening te krijgen. Huiseigendom is vaak niet gedocumenteerd, zodat dit niet als onderpand kan dienen. Einde aan armoede begint bij kleine startups, en niet zoals de overheid denkt, met giften aan arme landen. De beste manier om kleine bedrijven te stimuleren is door het makkelijker te maken geld te lenen. Niet door ze geld te geven! Gratis geld wordt nou eeenmaal niet goed besteed.  Kortom, als iedereen een paar euro wegzet om uit te lenen zal de welvaart stijgen in die arme landen. Het mooie is, als een bedrijfje zijn lening heeft betaald, kan je het geld hergebruiken om nog meer bedrijven te steunen!

lenders.occupational_info: I am single parent and I see how difficult is to find kindergarten in Moscow. Many people are living here. So I have expirience of working with kinds and want to help parents and kids by basing the kindergarten. I already bought some materials. So I will appriciate your help with money for renting place.

lenders.name: Kenneth Tin-Kin Hung
lenders.loan_because: I care.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am an artist based in Brooklyn, NY. My works are often social-political driven.

In 2015 I created an art project called "Make It Rain". It consists of a limited circulation of 100,000 custom designed and printed currency called ∄MIR. The ∄MIR currency is strapped in 50 counts with a total quantity of 2,000 bundles available for purchase. The general public are provided an “investment opportunity” to trade U.S. dollars in exchange for this new currency. The initial exchange rate is $1 USD to ∄1 MIR.

25% of each ∄MIR sold will be used as sustainable loans to help entrepreneurs in developing world through the non-profit Kiva.org.

Check out the project page:
http://www.tinkin.com/portfolio-item/make-it-rain/

Besides making arts I am also an entrepreneur. I co-founded a crownfunding platform called www.FUNraiser.us.

My wife and I also owned a tiny little wine shop called The Winey Neighbor in Brooklyn (www.wineyneighbor.com)
